english: give as a present; send to

etymology.description: 送(送) (sòng, "deliver; send") and 给(給) (gěi, "to give") combine to describe the action of giving or sending something to someone, often as a present or gift.
etymology.interpretation: 送给(送給) (sònggěi) makes sense as it combines the concepts of sending or delivering (送) with the notion of giving (给), highlighting the act of gifting or presenting something to someone.

parts.english: deliver; send; carry out; see off

examples.chinese: 我写了一张贺卡(我寫了一張賀卡)，送给远方的朋友(送給遠方的朋友)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xiěle yī zhāng hèkǎ, sònggěi yuǎnfāng de péngyǒu.
examples.english: I wrote a greeting card and sent it to a friend far away.

examples.chinese: 他把鲜花送给母亲(他把鮮花送給母親)。
examples.english: He sent flowers to his mother.
